intro: Libanotis dolichostyla, commonly known as the long-styled libanotis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its elongated stamens and distinctive floral structure make it a notable species in its native habitat. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
